info.title: NamSor API v2
info.description: NamSor API v2 : enpoints to process personal names (gender, cultural origin or ethnicity) in all alphabets or languages. By default, enpoints use 1 unit per name (ex. Gender), but Ethnicity classification uses 10 to 20 units per name depending on taxonomy. Use GET methods for small tests, but prefer POST methods for higher throughput (batch processing of up to 100 names at a time). Need something you can't find here? We have many more features coming soon. Let us know, we'll do our best to add it!

externalDocs.description: NamSor API client SDKs v2 for Java, Python

tags.name: Personal
tags.description: Personal names (anthroponyms) : gender, country origin/ethnicity, diaspora, US 'race'/ethniciy

get.summary: Activate/deactivate anonymization for a source.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The API Key to set as anonymized.

get.summary: Prints the current status of the classifiers. A classifier name in apiStatus corresponds to a service name in apiServices.
Receive information on your subscription plan and current API usage.
Print your API usage history.
Print your API usage history in an aggregated view (by service, by day/hour/min).
Receive a list of the API services and usage costs in Units.
Find the most likely Mandarin transcriptions for a Chinese first name and last name, written in Pinyin

post.summary: Find the most likely Mandarin transcriptions for up to 100 Chinese first and last names, written in Pinyin

requestBody.description: A list of personal Chinese names in LATIN, firstName = chineseGivenName; lastName=chineseSurname

post.summary: Find the most likely transcriptions for a romanized Chinese first name and last name

requestBody.description: A list of personal Chinese names in LATIN, firstName = chineseGivenName; lastName=chineseSurname

get.summary: Determine the most likely Mandarin transcriptions for a romanized Chinese first name and last name, accrding to the known gender of the name
Receive a score for matching a romanized Chinese name with its Mandarin writing.

post.summary: Identify Chinese name candidates, based on the romanized name (firstName = chineseGivenName; lastName=chineseSurname), ex. Wang Xiaoming

requestBody.description: A list of personal Chinese names in LATIN, firstName = chineseGivenName; lastName=chineseSurname

get.summary: Infer several classifications for a cross border interaction between names (ex. remit, travel, intl com)

post.summary: Infer several classifications for up to 100 cross border interaction between names (ex. remit, travel, intl com)

requestBody.description: A list of name pairs, with country code (nameFrom -> nameTo).

200.description: A list of classified name pairs.

get.summary: Infer the likely country of residence of a personal full name, or one surname. Assumes names as they are in the country of residence OR the country of origin.

post.summary: Infer the likely country of residence of up to 100 full names or last names.

get.summary: Find out the likely ethnicity or diaspora of a first name and last name, according to the country of residence

200.description: A list of diaspora / ethnicity given a name and residency.

requestBody.description: A list of names, with country code.

requestBody.description: A list of personal names, with a country ISO2 code

requestBody.description: A list of names, with country code.

get.summary: Suggest a transcription of a Japanese name between Kanji characters and Latin alphabet to help us improve our name matching tool.
Activate/deactivate learning from a source.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The API Key to set as learnable/non learnable.

get.summary: Detect if a proper noun is a personal name or a public name

post.summary: Detect if proper nouns are personal names or public names (ex: John Smith : personal name, Namsor: brand name). You can inspect up to a 100 names

get.summary: Detect if a proper noun is a personal name or a public name, according to its local context (ex: John Smith : personal name, Namsor: brand name)

post.summary: Detect if proper nouns are personal names or a public names, according to their local context (ex: John Smith : personal name, Namsor: brand name). You can inspect up to 100 names.

get.summary: Detect the likely country of origin of a first name and last name structure. For countries like U.S.A, Canada, Australia or New-Zealand and other melting-pots, refer to 'diaspora'.

post.summary: Detect the likely country of origin of up to 100 first and last names.

post.summary: Detect the likely first and last name structure of up to 100 a Chinese names, written in Mandarin, ex. 王晓明 -> 王(lastname) 晓明(first name).

get.summary: Split a full name into a likely first and last name structure. For better accuracy, provide a local context.

post.summary: Detect the likely first and last name structure of up to 100 full names. For better accuracy, provide a local context.

get.summary: Identify the likely country and phone prefix of a name and phone number.

200.description: A name with country and phone code.

get.summary: Determine the most likely U.S. race or ethnicity of a U.S. resident's first and last name

200.description: a US resident's likely race/ethnicity : W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino), AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native*) and PI (Pacific Islander*). *optionally

post.summary: Detect the most likely U.S. race or ethnicity of a up to 100 U.S. residents' first and last names.

200.description: A list of US resident's likely race/ethnicity. W_NL (white, non latino), HL (hispano latino),  A (asian, non latino), B_NL (black, non latino), AI_AN (American Indian or Alaskan Native*) and PI (Pacific Islander*). *optionally
